rules.ruleString: Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {ECB1102, ECF1200, ECG1102, ECW1102}
Must be enrolled in course type {10, 41, 50}

description: An introduction to the study of economics from a macroeconomic perspective including the following areas of study: trade in a global village, GDP as National Income and Aggregate Expenditure, savings and investment, unemployment, money and the South African monetary system, aggregate demand and supply in the short and long run, monetary and fiscal policy, including the related debates in South Africa as an open economy and as a major economy in Africa.
